divs: sighting detailsi was on a break from work and went for a short bike ride on a common path. i sat on a bench for a few minutes and looked up towards the moon which was just sw of dead center overhead. to the south of the moon i noticed what appeared to be a star. this star was very high which is a main reason that it appeared to me to be a star. this light began moving slowly towards the south where eventually i lost it as it got closer to the sun. i chaled it up to being something pretty cool to see but probably just a mylar balloon or something of the sort. i was unsure of how high they could get prior to bursting. there were other planes w\contrails in the sky and they seemed unaffected by whatever was up there. i phoned my parents who live in michigan and told my mother what i saw only to be told by my father (usaf ret.) that he had seen something strikingly similar back in michigan only a week prior. the next day i took my break around 40 minutes later. i sat in the same place and looked up. at first there was nothing, then i saw it again. this told me for sure that this was not some random balloon and this time it moved to the east, and i followed it for 15 minutes. since i was only three miles from my house i tried to ride the rest of the wy home to break out my telescop and attempt to make out possible detail. i stopped every few hundred yards to ensure that i did not lose sight of it in the high sky. by the time i got home it was gone. sadly, i cannot put any great detail into this as it simply appeared as any star you would see at nighttime. i know it was not a plane and was not a helicopter. i spend a lot of time simply looking up, and have done so since i was a child. this was simply somehting i had no explanation for.
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in Gilbert
There were no other sightings in Gilbert on or around October 22nd 2008
Summary: Daytime sighting - star moving wavelike very high in the sky - consecutive days
